title: Docs: Create ARCHITECTURE.md
description:
## Objective
Document system architecture.

## File to Create
- ARCHITECTURE.md

## Sections
1. System Overview

   - Components
2. Beads Integration
   - How bd is used
   - Dependency patterns
3. Agent Roles
   - Responsibilities
   - Interactions
4. Dashboard
   - Tech stack
   - Data flow
5. Workflow
   - Task lifecycle
   - Handoff patterns
6. Scaling
   - Multiple agents
   - Multiple repos

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Diagrams included
- [ ] Technical details accurate
- [ ] Future considerations noted

title: Dashboard: Create FastAPI app skeleton with config
description:
## Objective
Create the core FastAPI application with proper structure.

## Files to Create
- dashboard/app.py - Main FastAPI app
- dashboard/config.py - Configuration (bd path, log file, etc.)

## App Requirements
- FastAPI app with title "Multi-Agent Dashboard"
- CORS middleware (localhost only)
- Static file mounting
- Jinja2 template configuration
- Health check endpoint at /health

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `uv run python -m dashboard.app` starts server
- [ ] GET /health returns {"status": "ok"}
- [ ] Templates directory configured
close_reason: Commit a7eb268: FastAPI app skeleton created with /health endpoint. No remote configured for PR.

title: Scripts: Create monitor.py terminal monitor
description:
## Objective
Create terminal-based monitoring script.

## File to Create
- scripts/monitor.py

## Features
- Poll bd list every 10 seconds
- Group beads by status
- Show agent assignments
- Display recent log entries
- Clear screen between updates

## Display Format
============================================================
MULTI-AGENT STATUS - 14:30:00
============================================================

[DEVELOPER]
  mab-abc123: Implement login endpoint (45m)
  mab-def456: Fix validation bug (12m)

[QA]
  mab-ghi789: QA: Login flow (5m)

------------------------------------------------------------
RECENT ACTIVITY
------------------------------------------------------------
  14:29:55 [developer-1] CLAIM: mab-abc123
  14:28:30 [qa-1] CLOSE: mab-xyz999

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Updates automatically
- [ ] Shows all active work
- [ ] Easy to read in terminal
close_reason: Commit b00df49, no remote for PR

title: QA: Dashboard API endpoints
description:
## Objective
Verify all dashboard API endpoints work correctly.

## Test Cases
1. GET /api/beads returns valid JSON
2. GET /api/beads?status=open filters correctly
3. GET /api/beads?label=dev filters correctly
4. GET /api/beads/ready returns only unblocked
5. GET /api/beads/{id} returns correct bead
6. GET /api/beads/{invalid} returns 404
7. GET /api/agents returns agent list
8. POST /api/beads creates new bead
9. SSE /api/logs/stream connects and streams

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All tests pass
- [ ] Error responses are consistent
- [ ] Performance acceptable (<500ms)
close_reason: Tests complete: 34 tests covering all beads API endpoints. Commit 54ca036

title: Dashboard: Create dependency graph visualization
description:
## Objective
Add visual dependency graph for beads.

## Library Options
- Mermaid.js (simple, text-based)
- D3.js (complex, interactive)
- Cytoscape.js (graph-focused)

## Recommended: Mermaid.js
- Simpler integration
- Auto-layout
- Supports flowchart syntax

## Implementation
- Generate Mermaid syntax from bd dep data
- Render in separate tab/modal
- Color nodes by status

## Example Output
graph TD
  A[Design] --> B[Implement]
  B --> C[Review]
  C --> D[QA]
  style A fill:#22c55e
  style B fill:#3b82f6

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Graph renders correctly
- [ ] Colors indicate status
- [ ] Clickable nodes
close_reason: Commit f634b6b - Mermaid.js dependency graph visualization with status colors and clickable nodes

title: Config: Create roles.yaml
description:
## Objective
Define role configurations.

## File to Create
- config/roles.yaml

## Content Per Role
roles:
  developer:
    prompt: prompts/DEVELOPER.md
    label_filter: dev
    color: green
    max_instances: 3
  qa:
    prompt: prompts/QA.md
    label_filter: qa
    color: blue
    max_instances: 2
  tech_lead:
    prompt: prompts/TECH_LEAD.md
    label_filter: architecture
    color: yellow
    max_instances: 1
  manager:
    prompt: prompts/MANAGER.md
    label_filter: null  # sees all
    color: purple
    max_instances: 1
  reviewer:
    prompt: prompts/CODE_REVIEWER.md
    label_filter: review
    color: cyan
    max_instances: 2

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All roles defined
- [ ] Colors assigned
- [ ] Filters correct
close_reason: Config file created and committed. All acceptance criteria met: all 5 roles defined, colors assigned, label filters configured.

title: Polish: Performance optimization
description:
## Objective
Optimize dashboard performance.

## Areas
1. Cache bd list results (5 second TTL)
2. Batch bd calls where possible
3. Lazy load bead details
4. Efficient SSE implementation

## Metrics
- API response time <200ms
- Dashboard load <1s
- SSE latency <500ms

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Performance meets targets
- [ ] No noticeable lag

- Drag-and-drop (stretch goal)

- [ ] Auto-refresh works
- [ ] Responsive on smaller screens

title: Dashboard: Implement /api/agents endpoints
description:
## Objective
Create endpoints for agent status monitoring.

## File to Create
- dashboard/routes/agents.py

## Endpoints
GET /api/agents         - List active agent sessions
GET /api/agents/{role}  - Agents of specific role

## Data Model
{
  "role": "developer",
  "instance": 1,
  "current_bead": "mab-abc123",
  "status": "working",
  "last_activity": "2025-01-24T14:30:00Z"
}

## Implementation
- Parse claude.log for SESSION_START entries
- Match with CLAIM entries to find current bead
- Track last activity timestamp

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Returns list of active agents
- [ ] Shows current bead per agent
- [ ] Updates in near-real-time
close_reason: Commit f62f969 - /api/agents endpoints implemented with 23 tests, no remote for PR

title: Scripts: Create spawn_agent.py
description:
## Objective
Create script to spawn role-based agents.

## File to Create
- scripts/spawn_agent.py

## Features
- Accept role argument (developer, qa, tech_lead, manager, reviewer)
- Accept instance number (default 1)
- Accept repo path (default current dir)
- Load role-specific prompt
- Set environment variables
- Open new terminal with claude session

## Usage
python scripts/spawn_agent.py developer --instance 1 --repo /path/to/repo

## macOS Terminal Integration
osascript -e 'tell app "Terminal" to do script "..."'

## Environment Variables to Set
- AGENT_ROLE
- AGENT_INSTANCE
- AGENT_LOG_FILE

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 5 roles work
- [ ] Multiple instances spawn
- [ ] Prompts load correctly
close_reason: Commit 238b201 - All 5 roles work, multiple instances spawn, prompts load correctly

4. test_filter_beads_by_label

7. test_list_agents
8. test_create_bead

## Setup

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Good coverage
- [ ] Tests are isolated
close_reason: Created tests/test_dashboard.py with 21 tests (101 total pass). No PR - no git remote configured. Commit: 7056b9f

title: Dashboard: Implement /api/beads endpoints
description:
## Objective
Create REST API endpoints for bead operations.

## File to Create
- dashboard/routes/beads.py

## Endpoints
GET  /api/beads              - List all beads (with filters)
GET  /api/beads/ready        - Ready beads only (no blockers)
GET  /api/beads/in-progress  - In-progress beads
GET  /api/beads/{id}         - Single bead details
POST /api/beads              - Create new bead

## Query Parameters for GET /api/beads
- status: open|in_progress|closed
- label: filter by label
- priority: filter by priority

## Implementation
- Use subprocess to call `bd list --json`
- Parse JSON output
- Apply filters

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All endpoints return valid JSON
- [ ] Filters work correctly
- [ ] Error handling for bd failures
close_reason: Implemented all /api/beads endpoints (GET list, GET ready, GET in-progress, GET by ID, POST create). Commit 676c408. No remote configured for PR.

title: Dashboard: Create live log viewer panel
description:
## Objective
Create collapsible panel showing live logs.

## Files to Create
- dashboard/templates/partials/log_panel.html

## Features
- Expandable/collapsible panel
- Auto-scroll to bottom
- Syntax highlighting for log types:
  - SESSION_START: green
  - CLAIM: blue
  - CLOSE: purple
  - ERROR: red
  - BLOCKED: orange
- Filter by agent role
- Filter by bead ID

## Implementation
- Connect to /api/logs/stream SSE
- Append new entries to list
- Keep last 100 entries in view

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Live streaming works
- [ ] Color coding applied
- [ ] Filtering works
- [ ] Auto-scroll toggleable

title: Config: Create labels.yaml
description:
## Objective
Define valid labels for the system.

## File to Create
- config/labels.yaml

## Content
labels:
  # Role labels
  dev: "Development work"
  qa: "QA/testing work"
  architecture: "Design/architecture"
  review: "Code review"

  # Type labels
  bug: "Bug fix"
  feature: "New feature"
  infra: "Infrastructure"
  docs: "Documentation"

  # Component labels
  dashboard: "Web dashboard"
  prompts: "Agent prompts"
  scripts: "Orchestration scripts"
  config: "Configuration"

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All labels documented
- [ ] Descriptions clear
- [ ] Used consistently in beads
close_reason: Created config/labels.yaml with all label definitions. Commit 1648306. No remote configured for PR.

title: Scripts: Create setup.sh initialization script
description:
## Objective
Create one-command setup script.

## File to Create
- scripts/setup.sh

## Steps
1. Check prerequisites (bd, uv, claude)
2. Create virtualenv with uv
3. Install dependencies
4. Initialize beads if needed
5. Print success message

## Usage
./scripts/setup.sh

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Works from fresh clone
- [ ] Handles existing setup gracefully
- [ ] Clear error messages
close_reason: Commit feb5896: setup.sh created and tested. Works from fresh clone, handles existing setup, clear error messages. Local-only (no git remote).

title: QA: Validate all prompts
description:
## Objective
Review all prompts for completeness and accuracy.

## Verification
For each prompt:
1. bd commands are syntactically correct
2. Role boundaries are clear
3. No overlap between roles
4. _COMMON.md is referenced
5. Workflow is unambiguous
6. Acceptance criteria are verifiable

## Cross-Check
- Developer doesn't do QA work
- QA doesn't write production code
- Tech Lead doesn't do prioritization
- Manager doesn't make architecture decisions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All prompts reviewed
- [ ] No conflicting instructions
- [ ] Commands validated

title: Dashboard: Implement SSE log streaming
description:
## Objective
Create Server-Sent Events endpoint for real-time log streaming.

## File to Create
- dashboard/routes/logs.py

## Endpoints
GET /api/logs/stream    - SSE endpoint for live logs
GET /api/logs/recent    - Last N log entries

## Implementation
- Use `tail -f` subprocess for log following
- Yield events as SSE format
- Filter by role/bead if requested

## SSE Format
data: {"timestamp": "...", "role": "developer", "event": "CLAIM", "message": "..."}

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SSE connection stays open
- [ ] New log entries stream in real-time
- [ ] Handles log file rotation gracefully
close_reason: Implemented SSE log streaming endpoints. Commit 72c67de. All 46 tests pass.
